refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect2.title: AccessibleSelection_ref ()
refsect2.para: Increment the reference count for an AccessibleSelection object.

listitem.simpara: a pointer to the AccessibleSelection implementor on which to operate.

refsect2.title: AccessibleSelection_unref ()
refsect2.para: Decrement the reference count for an Accessible object.

listitem.simpara: a pointer to the AccessibleSelection implementor on which to operate.

refsect2.title: AccessibleSelection_getNSelectedChildren ()
refsect2.para: Get the number of children of an AccessibleSelection implementor which are currently selected.

listitem.simpara: a pointer to the AccessibleSelection implementor on which to operate.
a long indicating the number of Accessible children of the AccessibleSelection implementor which are currently selected.

refsect2.title: AccessibleSelection_getSelectedChild ()
refsect2.para: Get the i-th selected Accessible child of an AccessibleSelection. Note that childIndex refers to the index in the list of 'selected' children and generally differs from that used in #Accessible_getChildAtIndex() or returned by #Accessible_getIndexInParent(). selectedChildIndex must lie between 0 and #AccessibleSelection_getNSelectedChildren()-1, inclusive.

listitem.simpara: a pointer to the AccessibleSelection on which to operate.
a long indicating which of the selected children is specified.
a pointer to a selected Accessible child object, specified by childIndex.

refsect2.title: AccessibleSelection_selectChild ()
refsect2.para: Add a child to the selected children list of an AccessibleSelection. For AccessibleSelection implementors that only allow single selections, this may replace the (single) current selection.

listitem.simpara: a pointer to the AccessibleSelection on which to operate.
a long indicating which child of the Accessible is to be selected.
TRUE if the child was successfully selected, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: AccessibleSelection_isChildSelected ()
refsect2.para: Determine whether a particular child of an AccessibleSelection implementor is currently selected. Note that childIndex is the index into the standard Accessible container's list of children.

listitem.simpara: a pointer to the AccessibleSelection implementor on which to operate.
an index into the AccessibleSelection's list of children.
TRUE if the specified child is currently selected, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: AccessibleSelection_deselectSelectedChild ()
refsect2.para: Remove a child to the selected children list of an AccessibleSelection. Note that childIndex is the index in the selected-children list, not the index in the parent container. selectedChildIndex in this method, and childIndex in AccessibleSelection_selectChild are asymmettric.

listitem.simpara: a pointer to the AccessibleSelection on which to operate.
a long indicating which of the selected children of the Accessible is to be selected.
TRUE if the child was successfully deselected, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: AccessibleSelection_clearSelection ()
refsect2.para: Clear the current selection, removing all selected children from the specified AccessibleSelection implementor's selection list.

listitem.simpara: a pointer to the AccessibleSelection implementor on which to operate.
TRUE if successful, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: AccessibleSelection_selectAll ()
refsect2.para: Attempt to select all of the children of an AccessibleSelection implementor. Not all AccessibleSelection implementors support this operation.

listitem.simpara: a pointer to the AccessibleSelection implementor on which to operate.
TRUE if successful, FALSE otherwise.
